com.datastax.oss.driver.api.core

Interface AsyncAutoCloseable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    AsyncCqlSession, ContinuousReactiveSession, ContinuousSession, CqlSession, DseSession, GraphSession, ReactiveGraphSession, ReactiveSession, Session, SyncCqlSession

    public interface AsyncAutoCloseable
extends AutoCloseable
    An object that can be closed in an asynchronous, non-blocking manner.

    For convenience, this extends the JDK's AutoCloseable in order to be usable in try-with-resource blocks (in that case, the blocking close() will be used).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default void close()
      CompletionStage<Void> closeAsync()
      Initiates an orderly shutdown: no new requests are accepted, but all pending requests are allowed to complete normally.
      CompletionStage<Void> closeFuture()
      Returns a stage that will complete when close() or forceCloseAsync() is called, and the shutdown sequence completes.
      CompletionStage<Void> forceCloseAsync()
      Initiates a forced shutdown of this instance: no new requests are accepted, and all pending requests will complete with an exception.
      default boolean isClosed()
      Whether shutdown has completed.

    • Method Detail

      • closeFuture

        @NonNull
CompletionStage<Void> closeFuture()
        Returns a stage that will complete when close() or forceCloseAsync() is called, and the shutdown sequence completes.

      • isClosed

        default boolean isClosed()
        Whether shutdown has completed.

        This is a shortcut for closeFuture().toCompletableFuture().isDone().

      • closeAsync

        @NonNull
CompletionStage<Void> closeAsync()
        Initiates an orderly shutdown: no new requests are accepted, but all pending requests are allowed to complete normally.
        Returns:
        a stage that will complete when the shutdown sequence is complete. Multiple calls to this method or forceCloseAsync() always return the same instance.

      • forceCloseAsync

        @NonNull
CompletionStage<Void> forceCloseAsync()
        Initiates a forced shutdown of this instance: no new requests are accepted, and all pending requests will complete with an exception.
        Returns:
        a stage that will complete when the shutdown sequence is complete. Multiple calls to this method or close() always return the same instance.

      • close

        default void close()

        This method is implemented by calling closeAsync() and blocking on the result. This should not be called on a driver thread.

        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
